div1.p: J'ai l'honneur de vous accuser réception de votre lettre du 14e par laquelle vous me faites parvenir la réponse de Roi d'Hawaii á la notification du Roi comme Souverain de l'Etat Indépendant du Congo. Je me suis de faire parvenir cette réponse á sa haute destination.
J'ai également reçu la réponse á ma notification.
div1.fw: M. Victor Forge, Consul Général du Royaume d'Hawaii, Anvers
div1.p: Consulat général du Royaume d'Hawaii en Belgique.

Me conformant aux ordres de mon Gouvernement J'ai l'honneur de vous remettre un 'que Son Excellence Monsieur Walker M. Gibson Ministre des Affaires Etrangéres d'Hawaii m'a chargé de vous faire parvenues et qui renferme, outra la copie d'usage, une lettre autographe de Sa Majesté Hawaïenne à Sa Majesté Léopold II, au sujet de Son avènement comme Souverain du l’État Indépendant du Congo.
Je vous d'agréer, Monsieur l'Administrateur Général, l'assurance de ma plus haute considération
div1.fw: Monsieur Edmond Van Eetvelde Administrateur Général de l'Etat Indépendant du Congo à Bruxelles.

div1.p: Sir My Brother, I have received and have read with interest the letter in which Your Majesty has been so good as to inform me that by the wish of the International Association of Congo He has assumed the title of Sovereign of the Independent Congo State. I have watched with great interest the great experiment of civilization, colonization and commerce in which the International Association of the Congo is engaged and whilst I felicitate the Association upon the happy circumstance that a Monarch so talented and so much esteemed as is Your Majesty has acceded to its desire and become the Chief of the new State I must also congratulate Your Majesty upon the arrival of an opportunity so congenial to His temperament and exalted aspirations as is afforded to Him in this sovereignty. I gladly avail Myself of this occasion to assure Your Majesty of the high esteem and constant friendship with which I am

Sir: My Brother Your
Your Majesty's good brother
div1.fw: To His Majesty Leopold II Brussels.

div1.p: I have the honor to accuse you with reception of your letter from the 14th by which you sent to me the response of King of Hawaii at the notification of the King as Sovereign of the Independent State of the Congo. I understood to send this response to its high destination.
I equally received the response at my notification.
div1.fw: Mr. Victor Forge General Consul of the Kingdom of Hawaii, Anvers.
div1.p: General Consulate of the Kingdom of Hawaii in Belgium.

Informing me on the orders of my government I have the honor to return to you a that His Excellency Mister Walker M. Gibson Minister of Foreign Affairs of Hawaii charged me with sending to you and which encloses, as well as the copy of usage, a letter written by His Hawaiian Majesty to His Majesty Léopold II, on the subject of his accession as Sovereign of the State independent of the Congo.
I you to accept, Mister General Administrator, the assurance of my most high consideration
div1.fw: Mr. Edmond Van Eetvelde General Administrator of the Independent State of the Congo in Brussels.
